data.description: ACT ONE is a structural screenplay element rather than a character. It serves as a narrative marker denoting the beginning of the first act of the story, appearing at the conclusion of the teaser sequence. It functions as a transitional device within the script's formatting conventions.
data.dialogue_summary: ACT ONE has no dialogue. It is a non-speaking structural label used in the screenplay to indicate the commencement of the first act following the teaser sequence.

inferred_traits.rationale: ACT ONE appears as a standalone heading following 'END OF TEASER', consistent with standard screenplay formatting to delineate major structural divisions of the story.
Placement immediately after the teaser's closing line indicates it marks the formal start of Act One narrative content, a common television and film script convention.
inferred_traits.value: Signals transition from teaser/cold open into the main body of the first act
